Authors:
Izumi Okane, Yuho Ando, Yuichi Yamaoka, Mitsuteru Akiba,
Shinya Kubo
Title:
First report of heteroecism in Stereostratum corticioides,
the causal agent of bamboo culm rust
Keywords:
Choerospondias axillaris, DNA sequence analysis,
Inoculation experiments, Life cycle, Puccinia corticioides
Abstract:
Aecidium sp., which causes rust disease in Choerospondias
axillaris (Anacardiaceae), was found on Kyusyu Is., Japan. A sequence
analysis of genome ribosomal DNA showed that this rust fungus
genetically matches Stereostratum corticioides, a causative agent of
culm rust disease of bamboos and broadleaf bamboos. Inoculation
experiments and further nucleotide sequence analyses that included
additional fungal material showed that Aecidium sp. is conspecific with
S. corticioides, a species whose spermogonial and aecial stages were
previously unknown. Thus, we demonstrated heteroecism in S. corticioides
for the first time. We also propose that the binomial Puccinia
corticioides should be revived to replace Stereostratum
corticioides.
